{{autobiography|date=September 2012}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = 3D Na'Tee | image = | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Samantha Davon James | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1986|12|18}} | birth_place = [[New Orleans]], [[Louisiana]] | origin = [[New Orleans]], [[Louisiana]] | death_date = | death_place = | genre = [[Hip hop music|Hip hop]] | occupation = [[Rapping|Rapper]] | instrument = | years_active = 1994–present | label = Already Legendary, BMB | associated_acts = | website = {{URL|www.3DNATEE.com}} }}
'''Samantha Davon James''' (born December 18, 1986), better known by her stage name '''3D Na'Tee''', is an American [[rapper]], songwriter, and video director. She was born in [[New Orleans, Louisiana]] and grew up in the [[3rd Ward of New Orleans|3rd Ward]]. 3D Na'Tee has been featured on several national media outlets such as [[MTV]],<ref>{{cite web|title=MTV: SuckaFree Freestyle: 3D Na'Tee|url=http://www.mtv.com/videos/misc/651008/sucker-freestyle-3dnatee.jhtml|accessdate=May 8, 2011}}</ref> [[The Source (magazine)|The Source Magazine]],<ref name="thesource">{{cite web|title=THE SOURCE MAGAZINE: Top Up & Coming Female Rapper Releases Her Latest Project|url=http://www.thesource.com/articles/235038/}}</ref> [[XXL (magazine)|XXL Magazine]],<ref>{{cite web|title=XXL: Surviving The Times: Erick Sermon Talks About New Mixtape, Digital Label & Reviving Skills|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/features/2012/05/surviving-the-times-erick-sermon-talks-about-new-mixtape-digital-label-reviving-skills/}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=SHAHEEM REID: 5 STAR REVIEW FROM XXL'S EDITOR-AT-LARGE SHAHEEM REID & @TEAMSHAHEEM|url=http://3dnatee.com/main/?p=1340}}</ref> The Fader Magazine,<ref>{{cite web|title=THE FADER MAGAZINE: Features 3D Na'Tee - Lil Kim|url=http://www.thefader.com/index.php?s=na%27tee&submit.x=0&submit.y=0&submit=Go}}</ref> RapRadar<ref>{{cite web|title=RAPRADAR: RapRadar Search Features|url=http://rapradar.com/?s=3D+na%27tee&x=0&y=0}}</ref> and RapRehab.<ref>{{cite web|title=RAPREHAB: RapRehab's Featured Artist|url=http://raprehab.com/2012/08/3d-natee-new-orleans/}}</ref> She has also received attention from Louisiana newspapers and music magazines.<ref>{{cite web|title=THE SMOKING SECTION: 3D Na'Tee is Back and we have been invited to her Coronation|url=http://smokingsection.uproxx.com/TSS/2012/07/3d-natee-the-coronation-mixtape}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=NOLA.COM: 4X Nola HipHop Award Winner 3D Na'Tee Raises The Bar Again By Being The First Native HipHop Artist With A Mobile App|url=http://www.nola.com/music/index.ssf/2011/09/industry_influence_celebrates.html}}</ref>
==Early life== In her middle school years, 3D Na'Tee honed her skills by what is called in New Orleans, ribbin' (rib - ing). Most people know this as "Playing the Dozens". Someone would start a beat by beating on a lunch room table or a garbage can, and off she went, lyrically attacking someone who was bold enough to test her skill. The rhymes were mostly about what they were wearing, how lame they were, or silly they looked.
In 1999, she began recording with local label called '''Clientell Records'''. Over the next five years, she would record multiple mixtapes under the "Snypa Squad" and feature on other projects Clientell Records came out with. However, in 2006, a year after [[Hurricane Katrina]], Clientell Records dismantled and 3D Na'Tee, who had previously established herself as a battler rapper amongst the local rap scene in New Orleans, released her first mix tape project '''"3's Company Vol.1: The Rapper, The Hustler, the Diva"''' followed by '''Volume 2''' in 2007. After the release of her second project, she appeared on '''The Kush 2''' DVD which was produced by [[YMCMB]] president [[Mack Maine]]. The DVD featured other Cash Money/Young Money artist like [[Lil Wayne]], [[Nicki Minaj]], and [[Birdman (entertainer)|Birdman]] as well as [[Curren$y]] of [[Warner Bros. Records]]
==Career== After the local success of her first two releases and her critically acclaimed appearance on '''The Kush 2''', she released her third mix tape '''Heavy Is the head That Wears The Crown''' followed by a music video for a song she titled, '''Guess Who's Coming 2 Dinner'''. That video piqued the interest of [[G-Unit Records]] affiliate and [[Shade 45]] [[Sirius Satellite Radio|Sirius XM]] radio host Nelson Gomez who invited her to [[New York City|New York]] for an interview on his XM show as well as on rapper [[50 Cent|50 Cents']] wildly popular ThisIs50.com website. Soon after, the talk of her third release also got her featured in HipHop Weekly Magazine by [[Benzino]], former co-owner of [[The Source Magazine]].<ref>{{cite web|title=3DNATEE.COM: BIO|url=http://3dnatee.com/main/?page_id=28}}</ref>
Because of video releases like Guess Who's Coming 2 Dinner which spoofed many mainstream hip hop artists, 3D Na'Tee's music has been described as controversial and sometimes offensive.<ref>{{cite web|title=WOMEN OF HIPHOP: 3D Na'Tee Explains How HipHop Saved Her Life, Talks Female Rap, and More|url=http://thewomenofhiphop.com/2012/08/04/wohh-exclusive-3d-natee-explains-how-hip-hop-saved-her-lifetalks-female-rap-more/}}</ref> That song also shared the title of her for mix tape released in 2010.
'''Guess Who's Coming 2 Dinner''' (The Mixtape) lead to 3D Na'Tee being nominated for a total of 5 Nola HipHop Awards by her in her home town at the NOLA Hiphop Awards.<ref>{{cite web|title=OFFBEAT MAGAZINE: Nola HipHop Awards Nominees Finalized|url=http://www.offbeat.com/2010/10/14/nola-underground-hip-hop-award-nominees-finalized/}}</ref> She won three awards (the most awards won by a single artist) for '''Lyricist of the Year''', '''Mixtape of the Year''', and '''Female Artist of the Year'''.<ref>{{cite web|title=ASHLEE NICOLE SPILLS: Winners of the 2010 HipHop Awards Announced|url=http://www.ashleenicolespills.com/2010/10/20/winners-of-the-2010-nola-underground-hip-hop-awards/}}</ref> The mixtape included collaborations from [[Curren$y]] (courtesy of Warner Bros. Records), '''Ebony Eyez''',<ref>{{cite web|title=STL TODAY: Ebony Eyez Returns With A Story 2 Tell|url=http://www.stltoday.com/entertainment/music/ebony-eyez-returns-with-a-story-to-tell/article_6a65d3ae-d2bb-11e1-985c-0019bb30f31a.html}}</ref> and '''Babs Bunny''' (formally of [[Sean Combs|Sean "Diddy" Combs]]) founded group, [[Da Band]].<ref>{{cite web|title=SYFFAL: Forming Da Band|url=http://www.syffal.com/making-the-band}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=ALL MUSIC.COM: Da Band's Discography|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/da-band-mn0000764981}}</ref>
In early 2011 3D Na'Tee was featured on [[MTV|MTV's]] SuckerFree Freestyle<ref>{{cite web|title=MTV: SUCKERFREE FREESTYLE: 3DNATEE|url=http://www.mtv.com/videos/misc/651008/sucker-freestyle-3dnatee.jhtml}}</ref> hosted by [[DJ Envy]]. 3D Na'Tee and Syleena collaborated on a song called '''Go Head'''.<ref>{{cite web|title=RHAPSODY: Syleena Johnson|url=http://www.rhapsody.com/artist/syleena-johnson/album/chapter-v-underrated/track/go-head-feat-natee}}</ref>
July 27, 2011 3D Na'Tee released a video for '''Switch'''<ref>{{cite web|title=WORLDSTARHIPHOP: 3D Na'Tee's Switch|url=http://hp-www.worldstarhiphop.com/videos/video800.php?v=wshhd71614snrClf6d9H&set_size=1}}</ref> which she shot and edited herself. The song included several previously released instrumental versions of songs produced by super producer [[Timbaland]]. This video gained her a nomination for '''Director of the Year''' and an award for '''Video of the Year'''. Because of the momentum the Switch video gained the day of its release, Timbaland viewed it online and in less than 24 hours, flew 3D Na'Tee to [[The Hit Factory|Miami's Hit Factory Studio]] to work with her on her next project, The Coronation.<ref>{{cite web|title=THE FADER MAGAZINE: 3D Na'Tee - Lil Kim|url=http://www.thefader.com/2012/07/30/video-natee-lil-kim/#comments}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=ONWAX MAGAZINE: Rapper 3D Na'Tee shoots 'Wild' video in New Orleans, produced by Lex Luger|url=http://onwaxmagazine.com/owm/index.php/rapper-3d-natee-shoots-wild-video-in-new-orleans-produced-by-lex-luger/}}</ref> After several months spent traveling with Timbaland and other artist signed to his label, a contract was presented to 3D Na'Tee to sign to Timbaland's production company [[Mosley Music Group|Mosely Music Group]] and to be managed by members of Timbaland's management team. 3D Na'Tee and Timbaland later announced via [[Twitter]] that she was no longer a part of Timbaland's company because she decided not to sign the contract presented. In a later interview, 3D Na'Tee explained that there was no ill feelings towards Timbaland and cited her reasons for not signing were strictly because of contractual clauses that could not be agreed upon.<ref>{{cite web|title=DJSMALLZ.COM: INTERVIEW: SOUTHERN SMOKE TV! 3D NA'TEE (@3DNATEE) SPEAKS ON TURNING DOWN RECORD DEAL WITH TIMBALAND|url=http://www.djsmallz.com/blog/2012/5/18/interview-southern-smoke-tv-3d-natee-3dnatee-speaks-on-turni.html}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=WOMEN OF HIPHOP: [WOHH EXCLUSIVE]!|url=http://thewomenofhiphop.com/2012/08/04/wohh-exclusive-3d-natee-explains-how-hip-hop-saved-her-lifetalks-female-rap-more/}}</ref>
Exactly two years after 3D Na'Tee's last mix tape release, she released her highly anticipated street album ''The Coronation'' which featured artists like [[Keri Hilson]], Young Fletcher, and Lyrica Anderson. The Coronation also featured production from Mizay Entertainment's [[Lex Luger (producer)|Lex Luger]], [[Maybach Music Group|Maybach Music Group's]] Yung Shun, Heartbeatz, Casa Di, Versive Manhattan, Serious Beats, Da Smokestarz, among others.
In August 2012 it was announced by DJ Skee, Sirius Satellite Radio Host, that the first release from The Coronation entitled '''NO LOVE''' produced by [[Maybach Music Group|MMG's]] '''Young Shun''' was the #9 most requested song in the country.<ref>{{cite web|title=SIRIUS XM: #9 Song in the Country|url=https://twitter.com/DontHateBeHated/status/235174781102747648}}</ref> The Coronation's second release, '''Lil Kim''' produced by '''Casa Di''' gained tons of recognition as well as it was featured on both [[The Source (magazine)|The Source]] and [[The Fader]] Magazines' websites.<ref name="thesource" /><ref>{{cite web|title=FADER MAGAZINE: 3D Na'Tee Releases Lil Kim|url=http://www.thefader.com/2012/07/30/video-natee-lil-kim/#comments}}</ref> Lil Kim was a cautionary tale of a young girl with an absentee father who, because of her father's absence, unfortunately grew up and "fell in love" too fast. The song and its video (directed by Charley Mac), gained a lot of attention from tons of hiphop artist like [[Trina]], [[Missy Elliott]],<ref>{{cite web|title=WEBSTAGRAM: Trina Talks to 3D Na'Tee about 'Lil Kim|url=http://web.stagram.com/p/251601262639516075_14212753}}</ref> and Grammy Award Winning [[Chamillionaire]],<ref>{{cite web|title=BIG DOOR: Chamillionaire|url=http://www.bigdoor.com/company/press/grammy-award-winning-artist-and-bigdoor-ceo-to-speak-at-gamification-summit/}}</ref> who featured 3D Na'Tee's video on his famed social site [https://web.archive.org/web/20120802044043/http://www.chamillionaire.com/videos/play/608 www.chamillionaire.com].
==Discography==
===Albums=== *2012: ''The Coronation'' (Rerelease Plus Bonus Tracks) *2016: ''The Regime'' *2017: ''Songs That Didn't Make the Tape, Vol. 1''
===Mixtapes=== *2012: ''The Coronation'' *2010: ''Guess Who's Coming 2 Dinner'' *2008: ''Heavy Is The Head That Wears The Crown''

'''Gilbert Bani''' (born August 1, 1986) popularly known by his stage name '''A-Q''',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pulse.ng/reviews/pulse-album-review-a-q-embraces-the-new-wave-on-refreshing-rose-album-id5435108.html|title=Pulse Album Review: A-Q embraces the new wave on refreshing “Rose” album|first=Joey|last=Akan|website=Pulse.ng|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pulse.ng/buzz/rapper-aqs-new-album-blessed-forever-is-out-to-touch-a-life-id7089270.html|title=Rapper AQ"s new album "Blessed Forever" is out to touch a life|first=Abiola|last=Solanke|website=Pulse.ng|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dailypost.ng/music/2015/02/18/music-a-q-international-rapper-local-rappers-response-download/|title=Daily Post - Nigeria News, Nigerian Newspapers|website=Daily Post Nigeria|accessdate=22 May 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170809133724/http://dailypost.ng/music/2015/02/18/music-a-q-international-rapper-local-rappers-response-download/|archive-date=2017-08-09|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref><ref>[http://www.africanhiphop.com/aq-wahala-dey/] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170809132656/http://www.africanhiphop.com/aq-wahala-dey/ |date=2017-08-09 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://soundcity.tv/shows/my-music-i/my-music-i-with-a-q-working-with-jesse-jagz-m-i-naeto-c-rose-album/|title=‘My Music & I’ with A-Q - Working with Jesse Jagz, M.I., Naeto C & ‘Rose’ Album - SoundcityTV Africa - Powered by Music - South African Bongo Nigeria Ghana Music|website=soundcity.tv|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gleamglean.com/report.php?q=204 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130717080855/http://www.gleamglean.com/report.php?q=204 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-07-17 |title=Exclusive Interview with Fast Rising Nigerian Hip-Hop Artiste, A-Q }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://tooxclusive.com/download-mp3/q-jazzman-remix-ft-dj-spinall-yung6ix-dremo-new-song/|title=A-Q - Jazzman (Remix) ft. DJ Spinall, Yung6ix & Dremo [New Song]|date=2 August 2017|website=Tooxclusive.com|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref> is a [[Nigerian]] [[rapper]], [[recording artist]], [[dancer]], [[songwriter]], and [[performer]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://music.informationng.com/feautures/word-smith-lyrics-of-the-week-a-q|title=WORD SMITH: LYRICS OF THE WEEK - A-Q - Sounds.ng - Nigerian Music|date=4 December 2015|website=Music.informationng.com|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref>
'''A-Q''' was nominated for [[The Headies]] for best rap song artist 2016, for "Agu Ji Ndi Men".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thenet.ng/2016/12/headies-nominated-rapper-q-releases-new-song-titled-mmm/|title=TheNET.ng - Nigeria's Top Website for News, Gossip, Comedy, Videos, Blogs, Events, Weddings, Nollywood, Celebs, Scoop and Games|website=Nigerian Entertainment Today|accessdate=22 May 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171029230557/http://www.thenet.ng/2016/12/headies-nominated-rapper-q-releases-new-song-titled-mmm/|archive-date=2017-10-29|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://lifestyle.thecable.ng/headies-aq-mmm-rapper-song/|title=Headies-nominated rapper, A-Q, drops 'MMM'|date=13 December 2016|website=Lifestyle.thecable.ng|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://trendyafrica.com/the-debut-of-nigerian-controversial-rap-artiste-a-q/|title=The debut of Nigerian controversial Rap Artiste; A-Q|website=Trendy Africa|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.naijaloaded.com.ng/18/strongest-competition-rap-single-category-olamide-aq|title=“My Strongest Competition In The Rap Single Category Is Olamide”- AQ|date=16 December 2016|website=Naijaloaded.com.ng|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref>
==Early life== Born into a family of six as the last child, A-Q real name Gilbert Bani was raised in Surulere where he has lived for most of his life.
A-Q attended Kings College Lagos, and had his tertiary education at the University of Lagos. At a young age he started collecting hip-hop tracks, learning the lyrics and miming them. It didn’t take long before he started writing his own lyrics.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://9jaolofofo.com.ng/super-sunday-9jaolofofo-meets-rapper-aq-exclusive-interview/ |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130714002417/http://9jaolofofo.com.ng/super-sunday-9jaolofofo-meets-rapper-aq-exclusive-interview/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-07-14 |title=9jaolofofo Meets Rapper ‘A-Q’ (Exclusive Interview) }}</ref>
==Music career== A-Q signed his first record deal in 2001 with Big Leaf Records where he was for two years before he started working on his own in 2003. His first single "(W)rap Nigeria", produced by kraftmatics, debuted in 2004 followed by a music video. He subsequently released a full compilation album ''Listen and Understand'' in 2005 followed by another single, "Things That We Do", which got him an international online distribution deal. In 2006 A-Q put out a mixtape titled ''Maga Must Pay vol 1.''
A-Q took a break from music to finish his education in [[University of Lagos]] but still managed to release a single, "Make Money", and accompanying video in 2008 produced by Laylow and featuring Morachi and Xtrim off an online mixtape titled ''Love and Money.''
A-Q graduated in 2010 and returned to the entertainment industry, this time co-floating a record label, Hustle Inc, on whose platform he started Black Friday Twitter Freestyles, a weekly free download release. This got him online acknowledgement including from producer Don Jazzy who styled him “one of the sickest rappers alive”.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.underdarock.com/blog/don-jazzy-calls-a-q-one-of-the-sickest-rapper-alive/|title= one of the sickest rappers alive (Don Jazzy calls A-Q one of the sickest rapper alive)}}</ref> He recorded and released ''The Past Present and Future'' album in December 2010 which had the singles "Names" and "Champagne and Rum". He released more music including "Distractions" featuring Vector in 2012, "Machine Gun Flow", "555 (5beats 5verses and 5blessings)", and "Why" featuring Pamela.
He released an EP in December 2012 titled ''Make Your Best Rapper Look Stupid.'' He is currently working on his sophomore album titled ''G.I.L.B.E.R.T (Grace and Glory).''
==Discography== ===Albums=== *''Listen and Overstand'' (2005) *''The Past Present and Future'' (2010) *''Rose'' (2016) *''Blessed Forever'' (2017)
===Mixtapes and EPs=== *''Maga Must Pay Mixtape'' (2006) *''Love and Money'' (2008) *''Make Your Best Rapper Look Stupid'' (2012) *''Son of John'' (2014) *''Son of John 2'' (2015)
===Singles=== *"(W)rap Nigeria" (2005) *"Make Money" (2007)<ref>[https://archive.is/20130727135257/http://m.notjustok.com/2010/07/17/video-a-q-names-ft-xtrim-making-money-123-shots/] </ref> *"Names" (2010) *"Champagne and Rum" (2011)<ref>{{cite web|title=champagne rum|url=http://www.bellanaija.com/2010/10/08/new-music-aq-champagne-rum/|website=Bellanaija.com|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref> *"Why" (2012)

{{Use British English|date=July 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2016}} {{Infobox person | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Wolverhampton]], [[England]] | image = | caption = | death_date = | birth_name = | occupation = Actor | nationality = British | years active = 2009–present | website = {{url|http://www.AntonioAakeel.com/}} }}
'''Antonio Aakeel''' is an English actor. He was named by [[Screen International]] as a 2018 Star of Tomorrow for his leading role in ''[[Eaten by Lions (film)|Eaten by Lions]]'' and appeared opposite [[Alicia Vikander]] in Warner Bros.' ''[[Tomb Raider (film)|Tomb Raider]]'' reboot.<ref>{{cite web |title=Stars of Tomorrow |url=https://www.screendaily.com/features/stars-of-tomorrow-2018-antonio-aakeel-actor/5133183.article |website=Screen Daily |accessdate=8 November 2018 |ref=Screen International}}</ref> He is known for appearing in the [[BAFTA]] award-winning series ''[[Three Girls (miniseries)|Three Girls]]'', ''[[Skins (UK TV series)|Skins]]'' and was cast alongside [[Riz Ahmed]] in the 2016 thriller ''[[City of Tiny Lights]]''.
== Early life == Aakeel was born in [[Wolverhampton]], [[England]], and moved around the [[West Midlands (region)|West Midlands]] as a child.<ref>{{cite news|title=Wolverhampton actor secures feature-length international film role|url=http://nativemonster.com/film-and-theatre/film/wolverhampton-actor-secures-feature-length-international-film-role|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=NativeMonster}}</ref> He caught the acting bug after being given a one-line role in a school nativity play and went on to hone his craft through local theatre, before being scouted by a talent agent.<ref>{{cite news|title=Birmingham actor makes Hollywood Debut|url=http://whatsonlive.co.uk/birmingham/news/birmingham-actor-makes-hollywood-debut/36060|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=What's On Birmingham}}</ref> He speaks [[Punjabi language|Punjabi]] and [[Hindi]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Interview with Antonio Aakeel|url=http://scottishasianmagazine.com/interview-antonio-aakeel/|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=Scottish Asian Magazine}}</ref>
== Career ==
===Film===
Aakeel starred as Nasir Baloch in the 2013 political short film ''[[The Line of Freedom (film)|The Line of Freedom]]'' directed by David Whitney. The film depicts the true story of a murdered student rights activist and premiered at the [[Dubai International Film Festival]].<ref>{{cite news|title=The Line of Freedom Premiere|url=https://dubaifilmfest.com/en/films/23961/the_line_of_freedom.html|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=Dubai Film Festival}}</ref> Upon its release, the film was immediately met with controversy and allegedly resulted in Aakeel becoming a target of death threats.<ref>{{cite web|title=Where Is The Mainstream Coverage Of The Crisis In Balochistan?|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/where-is-the-mainstream-coverage-of-the-crisis-in-balochistan_us_57da9edee4b0d5920b5b25b2|website=Huffington Post|accessdate=16 Sep 2016}}</ref> The film was subsequently prohibited in Pakistan and reportedly contributed to a national ban of [[IMDb]].<ref>{{cite news|title=The Line of Freedom and the brief IMDb ban in Pakistan|url=https://globalvoices.org/2013/12/01/the-line-of-freedom-and-the-brief-imdb-ban-in-pakistan/|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=Global Voices}}</ref>
In 2015, he appeared as Raza in feature film ''[[The Contract (2015 Film)|The Contract]]'', written by [[David Marconi]] and directed by Nic Auerbach.
He was cast alongside [[Riz Ahmed]] and [[Billie Piper]] in London crime thriller ''[[City of Tiny Lights (film)|City of Tiny Lights]]'' directed by [[British Academy of Film and Television Arts|BAFTA]] winner [[Pete Travis]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Meet the young cast of City of Tiny Lights|url=http://screenterrier.blogspot.co.uk/2016/09/meet-young-cast-of-city-of-tiny-lights.html|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=ScreenTerrier}}</ref> The film had its world premiere at the [[Toronto International Film Festival]] 2016 and released in UK cinemas April 2017.<ref>{{cite news|title=Popular Birmingham actor to make big screen debut|url=https://iambirmingham.co.uk/2016/07/15/birmingham-actor-to-make-big-screen-debut/|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=I Am Birmingham}}</ref>
In December 2016, Aakeel landed a supporting role in ''The Hungry'', [[Film London| Film London's]] contemporary feature adaptation of [[Shakespeare|Shakespeare's]] [[Titus Andronicus]] alongside [[Naseeruddin Shah]] and [[Tisca Chopra]], directed by Bornila Chatterjee.<ref>{{cite news|title=Meet the Birmingham actor who has been cast in an international Shakespeare film|url=http://stylebham.com/life/meet-birmingham-actor-cast-international-shakespeare-film|accessdate=20 Jan 2017|publisher=StyleBham}}</ref> The Film premiered under special presentations at the 2017 [[Toronto International Film Festival]].<ref>{{cite web|title=The Hungry - TIFF|url=http://www.tiff.net/tiff/the-hungry/|website=tiff.net|accessdate=12 September 2017}}</ref>
It was announced in March 2017 that Aakeel will star as the lead in British feature film ''[[Eaten by Lions (film)|Eaten by Lions]]'', starring opposite comedians [[Johnny Vegas]] and [[Jack Carroll (comedian)|Jack Carroll]], directed by Jason Wingard.<ref>{{cite news|title=Antonio Aakeel to star as lead in British feature Eaten by Lions|url=http://www.identityschoolofacting.com/antonio-aak%CE%BE%CE%BEl-announced-as-lead-role-in-new-feature-eaten-by-lions/|accessdate=10 March 2017|agency=IAG}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=BHAM MAIL|url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/whats-on/film-news/billie-piper-helps-peaky-blinders-12848465|accessdate=23 April 2017}}</ref>
Aakeel appeared opposite [[Academy Awards|Oscar]]-winning actress [[Alicia Vikander]] in the franchise reboot ''[[Tomb Raider (film)|Tomb Raider]]'' (2018), directed by [[Roar Uthaug]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Birmingham actor Antonio Aakeel to star with Alicia Vikander in Tomb Raider re-boot|url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/whats-on/film-news/tomb-raider-antonio-aakeel-alicia-12848465|website=Birmingham Mail|accessdate=14 June 2017}}</ref>
===Television===
Aakeel landed his first television role in the British series ''[[Skins (UK TV series)|Skins]]''. He was chosen over 500 hopefuls by director [[Charles Martin (director)|Charles Martin]] and appeared in series 3 of the [[E4 (TV channel)|E4]] drama.<ref>{{cite web|title=Antonio Aakeel - NewUrban|url=http://www.new-urban.co/antonio-aakeel/|publisher=NUBI|accessdate=31 October 2016}}</ref>
He has gained guest-lead roles in [[BBC]] series ''[[Doctors (2000 TV series)|Doctors]]'' and [[BBC One]] drama series ''[[Moving On (TV series)|Moving On]]'' directed by [[Reece Dinsdale]].<ref>{{cite news|title=BBC Doctors|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b04bmv4j/credits|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=BBC}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Antonio Aakeel will star in BBC series Moving On|url=http://us4.campaign-archive1.com/?u=ae8e3d09be1e9c6b15ce45e66&id=68475a4b7a|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=Identity Drama}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Moving On returns as BBC One reveals new commissions|url=http://www.prolificnorth.co.uk/2016/10/moving-on-returns-as-bbc-one-reveals-new-commissions/|website=Prolific North|accessdate=31 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=BBC's Doctors to explore gender identity issues for the first time|url=http://www.gaytimes.co.uk/culture/52307/bbcs-doctors-explore-gender-identity-issues-first-time/|accessdate=31 October 2016|publisher=GayTimes.co.uk}}</ref>
In 2016, Aakeel was cast in ''Guilty Pleasures'' directed by Sonny Michael Chohan, a TV drama pilot based on real life [[sex trafficking]] circles in the [[UK]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Child grooming drama to premiere in Birmingham|url=https://iambirmingham.co.uk/2016/08/08/child-grooming-drama-premieres-in-birmingham/|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=I Am Birmingham}}</ref>
In May 2017 he appeared in the three-part [[BBC One]] drama ''Three Girls'' directed by [[BAFTA]] winner [[Philippa Lowthorpe]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Antonio Aakeel set to appear in BBC drama|url=http://www.asianimage.co.uk/news/14841782.Antonio_Aakeel_set_to_appear_in_BBC_drama__Moving_On_/|website=Asian Image|accessdate=3 Nov 2016}}</ref>
===Theatre===
In 2013, he played the title role in the stage adaptation of ''Guantanamo Boy''. The play ran at the [[Half Moon Theatre]] and toured nationally at [[Middle Temple|Middle Temple Hall]], [[Almeida Theatre]], [[The Hat Factory]], [[Mercury Theatre, Colchester|Mercury Theatre]], [[Burnley Youth Theatre]] and [[The Drum (Arts Centre)|The Drum Theatre]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Review: Guantanamo Boy|url=https://www.halfmoon.org.uk/review-guantanamo-boy-childrens-theatre-reviews/|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=Children's Theatre Reviews}}</ref> [[The Stage]]'s Susan Elkin wrote Aakeel "is great as the distraught, anguished, terrified Khalid. The downhill spiral followed by the final return of a damaged-for-life boy to Rochdale is well handled too. He has a very expressive face."<ref>{{cite news|title=Guantanamo Boy Theatre Review - WhatsonStage Susan Elkin|url=http://www.whatsonstage.com/london-theatre/reviews/11-2013/guantanamo-boy_32626.html|accessdate=23 August 2016|publisher=WhatsonStage.com}}</ref>
In 2015, he played the lead role of Artie in ''Waiting for Garbo'' at the [[Crescent Theatre]] as part of the Birmingham Theatre Festival. Love Midlands Theatre reviewed the performance, commenting his "portrayal of a brash New Yorker falling apart is utterly convincing."<ref>{{cite news|title=Waiting For Garbo Theatre Review|url=http://www.lovemidlandstheatre.co.uk/reviews/a-play-that-leaves-you-thinking|accessdate=23 August 2016|publisher=Love Midlands Theatre}}</ref>
Antonio has also performed locally with [[The Midlands|Midlands]] based theatre company Round Midnight.<ref>{{cite news|title=Follow me theatre play a success|url=http://redditchstandard.co.uk/news/round-midnights-follow-success-redditch/|accessdate=15 September 2016|publisher=The Redditch Standard}}</ref>

Aalto is a member of The [[Sri Chinmoy]] Marathon Team. In 2006, [[Tarja Halonen]], the President of [[Finland]], recognized him as an "International Ambassador of Sport".<ref name=md/>
== History == In 1999 he started running multi-day races.<ref name="rb" /> He ranked all-time second at the 3100 mile Race 2006. On October 29, 2006 Aalto finished the [[San Francisco]] One Day 24 hour endurance race in first place, logging just over {{convert|125|mi|km}} in a 24-hour period. Aalto is a three-time champion of [[Self-Transcendence 6- & 10-day Race|The Self-Transcendence Six Day Race]] in [[New York City]]. For three straight years he ran all three yearly Self-Transcendence multidays in [[New York City|New York]] (six days, {{convert|3100|mi|km}}, 700 miles).<ref name=apa/> He has won the world's longest certified footrace, the [[Self-Transcendence 3100 Mile Race]] eight times, finishing the 2015 race at record time 40 days 09:06:21 for a daily average of {{convert|76.776|mi|km}}.<ref name="2015-3100" /><ref name="rw" />

revision.text:
[[File:2 parallel footprints.png|thumb|Individual left and right footprints are chiral '''enantiomorphs''' in a plane because they are mirror images while containing no mirror symmetry individually.]] In [[geometry]], a figure is '''chiral''' (and said to have '''chirality''') if it is not identical to its [[mirror image]], or, more precisely, if it cannot be mapped to its mirror image by [[Rotation (mathematics)|rotation]]s and [[Translation (geometry)|translation]]s alone. An object that is not chiral is said to be achiral. In 3 dimensions, not all achiral objects have a mirror plane. For example, a 3-dimensional object with [[inversion centre]] as its only nontrivial [[symmetry operation]] is achiral but has no mirror plane.{{citation needed|date=December 2014}} A chiral object and its mirror image are said to be '''enantiomorphs'''. The word ''chirality'' is derived from the Greek {{lang|grc|χείρ}} (cheir), the hand, the most familiar chiral object; the word ''enantiomorph'' stems from the Greek {{lang|grc|ἐναντίος}} (enantios) 'opposite' + {{lang|grc|μορφή}} (morphe) 'form'. A non-chiral figure is called '''achiral''' or '''amphichiral'''. == Examples== [[File:3D Cartesian Coodinate Handedness.jpg|thumb|left|Left and [[right-hand rule]]s in three dimensions]] {| class=wikitable align=right |+ The [[tetromino]]s S and Z are enantiomorphs in 2-dimensions ![[File:Tetromino S.svg|100px]]
S ![[File:Tetromino Z.svg|94px]]
Z |} Some chiral three-dimensional objects, such as the [[helix]], can be assigned a right or left [[handedness]], according to the [[right-hand rule]]. Many other familiar objects exhibit the same chiral symmetry of the human body, such as gloves and shoes. Right shoes differ from left shoes only by being mirror images of each other. In contrast thin gloves may not be considered chiral if you can wear them [[wiktionary:inside out|inside-out]].{{citation needed|date=December 2014}} The J, L, S and Z-shaped ''[[tetromino]]es'' of the popular video game [[Tetris]] also exhibit chirality, but only in a two-dimensional space. Individually they contain no mirror symmetry in the plane. ==Chirality and symmetry group== A figure is achiral if and only if its [[symmetry group]] contains at least one ''orientation-reversing'' isometry. (In Euclidean geometry any [[isometry]] can be written as v\mapsto Av+b with an [[orthogonal matrix]] A and a vector b. The [[determinant]] of A is either 1 or −1 then. If it is −1 the isometry is ''[[orientation (mathematics)|orientation]]-reversing'', otherwise it is orientation-preserving.) See {{cite journal | author = Petitjean, M. | title = Chirality in metric spaces. In memoriam Michel Deza | journal = Optimization Letters | year = 2017 | doi = 10.1007/s11590-017-1189-7}} for a full mathematical definition of chirality. ==Chirality in three dimensions== [[File:Chiralität von Würfeln V.1.svg|thumb|Pair of chiral [[dice]] (enantiomorphs)]] In three dimensions, every figure that possesses a [[mirror plane of symmetry]] ''S1'', an inversion center of symmetry ''S2'', or a higher [[improper rotation]] (rotoreflection) ''Sn'' axis of symmetry{{cite web|title=2. Symmetry operations and symmetry elements|url=http://chemwiki.ucdavis.edu/Theoretical_Chemistry/Symmetry/Symmetry_operations_and_symmetry_elements|website=chemwiki.ucdavis.edu|accessdate=25 March 2016}} is achiral. (A ''plane of symmetry'' of a figure F is a plane P, such that F is invariant under the mapping (x,y,z)\mapsto(x,y,-z), when P is chosen to be the x-y-plane of the coordinate system. A ''center of symmetry'' of a figure F is a point C, such that F is invariant under the mapping (x,y,z)\mapsto(-x,-y,-z), when C is chosen to be the origin of the coordinate system.) Note, however, that there are achiral figures lacking both plane and center of symmetry. An example is the figure :F_0=\left\{(1,0,0),(0,1,0),(-1,0,0),(0,-1,0),(2,1,1),(-1,2,-1),(-2,-1,1),(1,-2,-1)\right\} which is invariant under the orientation reversing isometry (x,y,z)\mapsto(-y,x,-z) and thus achiral, but it has neither plane nor center of symmetry. The figure :F_1=\left\{(1,0,0),(-1,0,0),(0,2,0),(0,-2,0),(1,1,1),(-1,-1,-1)\right\} also is achiral as the origin is a center of symmetry, but it lacks a plane of symmetry. Note also that achiral figures can have a [[Point groups in three dimensions#Center of symmetry|center axis]]. ==Chirality in two dimensions== [[File:Bracelets33.svg|thumb|300px|The colored [[Necklace (combinatorics)|necklace]] in the middle is '''chiral''' in 2-dimensions, the two others are '''achiral'''.
This means that as physical necklaces on a table the left and right one could be rotated into their mirror image while remaining on the table. The one in the middle, however, would have to be picked up and turned in three dimensions.]] In two dimensions, every figure which possesses an [[axis of symmetry]] is achiral, and it can be shown that every ''bounded'' achiral figure must have an axis of symmetry. (An ''axis of symmetry'' of a figure F is a line L, such that F is invariant under the mapping (x,y)\mapsto(x,-y), when L is chosen to be the x-axis of the coordinate system.) For that reason, a [[triangle]] is achiral if it is [[equilateral triangle|equilateral]] or [[isosceles triangle|isosceles]], and is chiral if it is scalene. Consider the following pattern: :[[File:Krok 6.png|320px]] This figure is chiral, as it is not identical to its mirror image: :[[File:Krok 6 mirrored.png|320px]] But if one prolongs the pattern in both directions to infinity, one receives an (unbounded) achiral figure which has no axis of symmetry. Its symmetry group is a [[frieze group]] generated by a single [[glide reflection]]. ==Knot theory== A [[knot (mathematics)|knot]] is called [[amphichiral knot|achiral]] if it can be continuously deformed into its mirror image, otherwise it is called a [[chiral knot]]. For example, the [[unknot]] and the [[figure-eight knot (mathematics)|figure-eight knot]] are achiral, whereas the [[trefoil knot]] is chiral. ==See also== * [[Chiral polytope]] * [[Chirality (physics)]] * [[Chirality (chemistry)]] * [[Asymmetry]] * [[Skewness]] * [[Vertex algebra]] ==References== {{Reflist}} == External links == *[http://petitjeanmichel.free.fr/itoweb.petitjean.html The Mathematical Theory of Chirality] by Michel Petitjean *[http://petitjeanmichel.free.fr/itoweb.petitjean.symmetry.html Symmetry, Chirality, Symmetry Measures and Chirality Measures:] General Definitions * [http://demonstrations.wolfram.com/ChiralPolyhedra/ Chiral Polyhedra] by [[Eric W. Weisstein]], [[The Wolfram Demonstrations Project]]. * [http://www.cambridge.org/us/catalogue/catalogue.asp?isbn=9780521664820 When Topology Meets Chemistry] by [[Erica Flapan]]. *[http://www.map.mpim-bonn.mpg.de/Chiral_manifold Chiral manifold] at the Manifold Atlas. [[Category:Knot theory]] [[Category:Polyhedra]] [[Category:Chirality]] [[Category:Topology]]

{{Infobox video game | collapsible = | state = | italic title = | title = CryptoKitties | image = | alt = | caption = | developer = Axiom Zen | publisher = | series = | engine = | platforms = | released = 2017 | genre = [[Virtual pet]] | modes = }} '''''CryptoKitties''''' is a [[Blockchain game|blockchain]] based [[video game]] developed by Axiom Zen that allows players to purchase, collect, breed and sell various types of virtual cats.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Miller |first1=John |title=Animoca Brands one of the ASX top performers in 2018 |url=http://www.proactiveinvestors.com.au/companies/news/190721/animoca-brands-one-of-the-asx-top-performers-in-2018-190721.html |website=Proactive Investors |accessdate=7 October 2018 |date=29 Jan 2018}}</ref> It represents one of the earliest attempts to deploy blockchain technology for recreational and leisurely purposes.<ref>[https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3084411 Cryptokitties Analysis Paper] "The Leisures of Blockchains." Information Systems & Economics eJournal, Social Science Research Network (SSRN). Accessed 19 December 2017.</ref> The game's popularity in December 2017 congested the [[Ethereum]] network, causing it to reach an all-time high in transactions and slow down significantly.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-42237162 |title=CryptoKitties craze slows down transactions on Ethereum|last=|first=|date=2017-12-05|deadurl=no|accessdate=7 Oct 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Background== CryptoKitties is not a [[cryptocurrency]]. Instead it operates on [[Ethereum]]'s underlying blockchain network, as a [[Non-Fungible Tokens|non fungible token (NFT)]] unique to each CryptoKitty. Each CryptoKitty is unique and owned by the user, validated through the blockchain, and its value can appreciate or depreciate based on the market. CryptoKitties cannot be replicated and cannot be transferred without the user's permission even by the game developers. Users can interact with their CryptoKitties, having the ability to buy, sell, and sire (breed) them. A test version of CryptoKitties was unveiled at ETH Waterloo on October 19, 2017, the largest Ethereum [[hackathon]] in the world. As of December 2, 2017, Genesis, the first and highest selling cat was sold for 246.9255 [[Ethereum|ETH]] (~$117,712 USD) on that day.
The virtual cats are breedable and carry a unique number and 256 bit distinct genome with DNA and different attributes (cattributes) that can be passed to offspring.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2017/12/06/meet-cryptokitties-the-new-digital-beanie-babies-selling-for-100k.html|title=Meet CryptoKitties, the $100,000 digital beanie babies epitomizing the cryptocurrency mania|last=Cheng|first=Evelyn|date=2017-12-06|work=CNBC|access-date=2017-12-10}}</ref> Several traits can be passed down from the parents to the offspring. These include pattern, mouth (shape), fur, eye shape, base color, accent color, highlight color, eye color, and optional wild and environment characteristics. Other features like cool down times are not passed down but are instead a function of the 'generation' of the offspring, which is one higher than the maximum generation between the two parents.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://techcrunch.com/2017/12/03/people-have-spent-over-1m-buying-virtual-cats-on-the-ethereum-blockchain/|title=People have spent over $1M buying virtual cats on the Ethereum blockchain|last=Tepper|first=Fitz|work=TechCrunch|access-date=2017-12-10|language=en}}</ref> In December 2017 a CryptoKitty sold for $100,000.<ref name=":0" />
On March 20, 2018, it was announced that ''CryptoKitties'' would be spun off into its own company and raised $12 million from several top venture capital firms and angel investors. The investment round was led by New York based [[Union Square Ventures]] and San Francisco based [[Andreessen Horowitz]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.coindesk.com/a16z-leads-12-million-funding-for-ethereum-app-cryptokitties/|title=A16z, USV Lead $12 Million Funding for CryptoKitties - CoinDesk|date=2018-03-20|work=CoinDesk|last=Milano|first=Annaliese|access-date=2018-03-26|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://venturebeat.com/2018/03/20/cryptokitties-blockchain-sensation-raises-12-million/|title=CryptoKitties blockchain sensation raises $12 million|date=2018-03-20|work=VentureBeat|last=Takahashi|first=Dean|access-date=2018-03-26|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://medium.com/cryptokitties/cryptokitties-receives-12m-in-funding-38322f90ab65|title=CryptoKitties receives $12M in funding|last=CryptoKitties|date=2018-03-20|website=CryptoKitties|access-date=2018-03-26}}</ref>
In May 2018, ''CryptoKitties'' launched their first celebrity-branded CryptoKitty with [[Stephen Curry]], an American professional basketball player.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.coindesk.com/nba-superstar-steph-curry-now-first-celebrity-cryptokitty/|title=NBA Superstar Steph Curry Is Now the First Celebrity CryptoKitty - CoinDesk|date=2018-05-07|work=CoinDesk|access-date=2018-05-11|language=en-US}}</ref> As part of the partnership, Curry was given three CryptoKitties with special imagery, the first of which he put up for auction.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://venturebeat.com/2018/05/07/warriors-steph-curry-will-auction-off-celebrity-cryptokitties/|title=Warriors’ Steph Curry will auction off celebrity CryptoKitties|date=2018-05-07|work=VentureBeat|access-date=2018-05-11|language=en-US}}</ref> The company later suspended the auction, claiming that Stephen Curry wasn't as involved as they initially thought.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://ca.finance.yahoo.com/news/cryptokitties-quietly-suspends-currykitties-promotion-144800509.html|title=CryptoKitties Quietly Suspends ‘CurryKitties’ Promotion|access-date=2018-05-29|language=en-CA}}</ref> The company was later sued for trade secret theft over the Stephen Curry collectibles.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://venturebeat.com/2018/05/25/cryptokitties-sued-for-trade-secret-theft-over-stephen-curry-collectibles/|title=CryptoKitties sued for trade secret theft over Stephen Curry collectibles|date=2018-05-25|work=VentureBeat|access-date=2018-05-29|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.ccn.com/company-sues-cryptokitties-creator-for-allegedly-stealing-trade-secrets/|title=Company Sues CryptoKitties Creator for Allegedly Stealing Trade Secrets|date=2018-05-25|work=CCN|access-date=2018-05-29|language=en-US}}</ref>
In October 2018, ''CryptoKitties'' reached the milestone of 1 million cats being bred with a volume of 3.2 million transactions on its smart contracts.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://venturebeat.com/2018/10/06/cryptokitties-explained-why-players-have-bred-over-a-million-blockchain-felines/|title=CryptoKitties explained: Why players have bred over a million blockchain felines|date=2018-10-06|work=VentureBeat|access-date=2018-10-22|language=en-US}}</ref> In November 2018, Dapper Labs, which was spun out of Axiom Zen as the developer of ''CryptoKitties'', raised an additional $15 million in a venture round led by Venrock.The company doubled its valuation in this round.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-11-01/cryptokitties-maker-doubles-valuation-in-venrock-led-fundraising|title=CryptoKitties Maker Doubles Valuation in Venrock-Led Fundraising|last=|first=|date=|website=www.bloomberg.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-11-01}}</ref>
In 2018 ''CryptoKitties'' will help the German museum [[ZKM Center for Art and Media Karlsruhe]] explain blockchain.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Takahashi |first1=Dean |title=CryptoKitties will help German museum explain blockchain |url=https://venturebeat.com/2018/08/28/cryptokitties-will-help-german-museum-explain-blockchain/ |website=Venture Beat |accessdate=7 October 2018 |date=28 Aug 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Cant |first1=Joeri |title=CryptoKitties at German art exhibit 'Bringing Blockchain to Life' |url=https://www.chepicap.com/en/news/3286/cryptokitties-at-german-art-exhibit-bringing-blockchain-to-life-.html |website=Chepicap |accessdate=7 October 2018 |date=29 Aug 2018}}</ref>
== Technology ==
A CryptoKitties' ownership is tracked via a smart contract on the Ethereum blockchain. CryptoKitties are distributed automatically, via smart contract, at the rate of one every 15 minutes (672 per week) for one year. Each CryptoKitty is represented in the form of a non-fungible ERC-721 token, which allows for each entity to have specific cattributes.
Based on the limited number of cats going into circulation and their limited genomes, there is a limit of 4 billion total cats that can be bred.<ref name=":0" /> Each cat will have a distinct visual appearance ("phenotype") determined by its immutable genes ("genotype") stored in the smart contract. Because cats are tokens on a blockchain, they can be bought, sold, or transferred digitally, with strong guarantees of ownership. A CryptoKitty does not have a permanently assigned gender. While they can only engage in one breeding session at one time, each cat is able to act as either matron or sire. The owner chooses with each breeding interaction.
A group known as Axiom Zen innovation studio developed the game.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-12-04/cryptokitties-quickly-becomes-most-widely-used-ethereum-app|title=CryptoKitties Mania Overwhelms Ethereum Network's Processing|date=2017-12-04|work=Bloomberg|access-date=2017-12-10}}</ref> Until November 2018, Axiom Zen intends to continually release a new CryptoKitty every 15 minutes,<ref name=":0" /> with the rest of supply determined by breeding of CryptoKitties. CryptoKitty owners may put them up for sale via an auction for a price set in Ether (ETH).
== Reception == There are concerns that ''CryptoKitties'' is crowding out more serious, significant business that use the Ethereum platform. As of December 5, 2017 Etherscan has reported a sixfold increase in pending transactions on Ethereum since the game's release just a week earlier. "''CryptoKitties'' has become so popular that it's taking up a significant amount of available space for transactions on the Ethereum platform", said Garrick Hileman, from the University of Cambridge.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-42237162|title=CryptoKitties cripple Ethereum blockchain|date=2017-12-05|work=BBC News|access-date=2017-12-11|language=en-GB}}</ref> Ethereum miners increased the gas limit in response to ''CryptoKitties'', which allowed for more data per block and increasing transactions per second.{{cn|date=November 2018}}
